name: Google IO Extended 17 @ Covenant university
description:
Hey there,

This event is hosted by the Google developer community in Covenant University and Supported by Google.

By attending, you will have access to some trainings on some Google products as well as Google partner products ranging from Android,Tensorflow,Speechless Virtual Reality and more.

We will also watch the Global Keynote and other sessions over drinks and snacks even as we network and share Googly items. Sounds great right?

Come prepared for some awesomeness. See you there!

Eyitayo Alimi,

For the GDG Covenant University Team.

name: Study Jam -Web : Mobile Sites Certifications
description:
• What we'll do
This Meetups will bring together community members to improve their knowledge in mobile sites. There will be a 3-4 hour study period after which we have the Certification exam under a duration of 90 minutes.

Students that completes the exam will get a printable certificate and a Google Partners public profile page listing.

See you there.

• What to bring
Water bottle, Pen, Notebooks, Laptop.

• Important to know
Why do I need great mobile web skills?
Mobile now accounts for over half of all web traffic. Users expect their small-screen experiences to be as quick and intuitive as those on desktop. But making the mobile web fast and easy takes some special skills.
53% of mobile visitors will leave if a page takes more than three seconds to load. The average page takes 22 seconds to load, so collectively we're losing a lot of mobile users and giving them a bad experience along the way.

name: IWD
description: This is a Women Techmakers (WTM) event to celebrate the International Women’s Day (IWD)

name: Google IO Extended 2018
description:
This event is aimed at sharing my GoogleIO 2018 experiences and leanings with my community.

Featuring;
Google IO Keynote
Flutter Codelabs
What's new with Kotlin
What you should know about building community actions for Google assistant.
how_to_find_us: The 3rd building to your right on Olonade street.

name: Cloud Study Jam: Getting you started with Google Cloud.

venue.name: Hebron Startup Lab
venue.address_1: Hebron Startup Lab, 3rd Floor, CUCRID Building, Covenant University, Ota

description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam on the 27th October, 2018 by 9am prompt @ Hebron Startup Lab, 3rd Floor, CUCRID Building, Covenant University Ota.

Get official Google training, a $70+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through 4 Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the cloud console, Kubernetes and Machine Learning.

Then after the meetup, you will have free access to 3 more labs you can finish at home. Complete all 7 labs and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile.

Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

Agenda:
9:00am : 4 Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs
11:00am: Break
11:40am: Intro to Docker or Scientific Data Processing lab (Demo)
1:00pm: Event ends

name: Tinkering With Cloud Deployment: Scalability In Mind
description:
Want to get started on deploying your applications with high-end scalability in mind to the Cloud, even with little to no experience? Why not join us on the 26th January 2018 by 11 am prompt @ Diamond Bank, Covenant University Ota.

You will get hands-on experience deploying your applications (backend, frontend, databases etc.) to scale on the Cloud, while we effectively treat basic Deployment Strategies, Docker and Kubernetes.

BONUS:
Every individual will get an official Google training, a $70+ value, free of charge, which when completed, will earn you a Google-hosted badge for your online profile.

Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook), with your favorite text editor installed! For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.
